This chapter starts out with an apparently insignifican piece of sartorial ethnography. The issue is not what those plain-dressed people were doing, but what kinds of people were ruling the empire. It is not that they ruled the world, BUT wore simple clothes, but that they ruled BECAUSE their clothing was simple.
